```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(data.table)

setwd("//dc1fs/dc1ehd/share/Science Policy Portfolio/PatentsView IV/Documentation/Tables/20200331")
```


##loads in data
```{r load data}
data<- read.delim(unz("botanic.tsv.zip", "botanic.tsv"), header=TRUE, sep ="\t", comment.char="#",  stringsAsFactors = FALSE, quote="", fill = FALSE)
```

## displays summary of data

```{r view data}
head(data)
nrow(data)
ncol(data)
str(data)
summary(data)
missing<-sapply(data, function(x) sum(is.na(x)))
#View(missing)

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
